metadata.Title: CVE-2022-35256 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The llhttp parser in the http module in Node v18.7.0 does not correctly handle header fields that are not terminated with CLRF. This may result in HTTP Request Smuggling.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-35256` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
nodejs - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.2').
